analysisEngineMetaData.name: Dependency Locality Theory: High Adjacent IC at Finite Verb (no modifier weight + less coordination weight + added verb weight)
analysisEngineMetaData.description:
Calculates the average frequency of high adjacent IC (according to the DLT with cancelled modifier weight, reduced coordination weight, and increased verb weight) at the finite verb. High costs are defined as costs higher than 2 after integration.
AAE dependency: SentenceAnnotator.xml TokenAnnotator.xml LemmaAnnotator.xml MorphologicalTagAnnotator.xml POSAnnotator.xml DependencyParseAnnotator.xml

configurationParameter.name: dltConfiguration
configurationParameter.description: Configuration of total integration cost calculation. One of the following: o : original; +1 DIC for each noun and finite verb v : additional verb weigt; +1 DIC for each noun and non-finite verb, +2 for finite verbs c : reduced coordination weight: +1 for nouns unless they are non-initial conjuncts, +1 for finite verbs m : reduced modifier weight: +1 DIC for each noun that is not verb modifier or finite verb cm : combines reduced coordination and modifier weight cv : combines reduced coordination and additional verb weight vm : combines reduced modifier and additional verb weight cmv : combines reduced coordination and modifier weight with additional verb weight

configurationParameter.name: featureType
configurationParameter.description: Integration cost feature type. One of the following: totalIC average total integration cost maxIC average maximal integration cost highAdjacentIC average high adjacent integration cost
